Great Weapons.Description: Mastery of heavy impact weapons like greatswords and mauls.

The Ballistics.Description: Mastery of high-draw-weight ranged weapons like warbows and ballistae.

Intimidation.Description: Using physical presence and threats of violence to force compliance.

Athletics.Description: Action: Swimming, climbing, breaking objects. Lore: War tactics and sieges.

Heavy.Description: Mastery of full plate and heavy chitin armor. You are the anvil.

Shield.Description: Mastery of bucklers, heaters, and tower shields for active cover and bashing.

Stoicism.Description: Mastery of the ego. Remaining unbothered by insults, pain, or fear.

Labor.Description: Action: Sustained heavy work, carrying loads. Lore: Structure and masonry.

Small.Description: Mastery of precision weapons like rapiers, shivs, and stilettos.

Thrown.Description: Mastery of balanced throwing weapons like knives, axes, and kunai.

Repartee.Description: Using wit, mockery, and stinging insults to fluster an opponent.

Mechanism.Description: Action: Picking locks, disarming traps. Lore: Gears and complex devices.

Light.Description: Mastery of light hides and padded armor for maximum mobility.

Snares.Description: Mastery of caltrops, tripwires, and smoke bombs to control the ground.

Guile.Description: Feigning ignorance, hiding emotions, and deceiving others.

Motion.Description: Action: Acrobatics, stealth, balancing. Lore: Ballistics and physics of speed.

Natural.Description: Mastery of armor made from once-living things (furs, bone, wood).

Tinctures.Description: Mastery of non-magical aids like herbal salves, bandages, and stimulants.

Poise.Description: Being naturally radiant, likable, and projecting health/status.

Nature.Description: Action: Survival, handling animals. Lore: Biology, ecology, and healing.

Fist.Description: Mastery of unarmed strikes, cestus, and claws. Clinch fighting.

Simple.Description: Mastery of simple kinetic weapons like slings and shortbows.

Coercion.Description: Using relentless pressure and "The Gaze" to corner an opponent.

Craft.Description: Action: Repairing gear, smithing, hardening. Lore: Physiology and metallurgy.

Cloth.Description: Mastery of runed cloth and woven wards that require academic understanding.

Catalysts.Description: Mastery of items that channel magic, such as scrolls, wands, and staves.

Etiquette.Description: Using rank, protocol, and proper titles as a social shield.

Academics.Description: Action: Researching libraries. Lore: History, languages, and heraldry.

Medium.Description: Mastery of technical swordsmanship like katanas and arming swords.

Blast.Description: Mastery of chemical weapons, grenades, scatterguns, and fuse times.

Rhetoric.Description: Using facts, logic, and debate to dismantle arguments.

Analysis.Description: Action: Solving puzzles, deduction. Lore: Math, engineering, and chemistry.

Large.Description: Mastery of spears and halberds. Keeping enemies at exact range.

Long Shot.Description: Mastery of sniper rifles, crossbows, and flintlocks. Lining up the shot.

Insight.Description: Using cold reading to detect lies and expose secrets.

Scouting.Description: Action: Tracking, spotting danger. Lore: Forensics and investigation.

Utility.Description: Mastery of utility vests, ghillie suits, and "deep pockets" preparation.

Curios.Description: Mastery of gaming sets, dice, tarot, and tokens of luck/fate.

Empathy.Description: Sensing the "vibe," emotional intent, and defusing anger.

Mysticism.Description: Action: Gut-feeling pathfinding. Lore: Folklore, spirits, and omens.

Exotic Melee.Description: Mastery of performance weapons like whips and nunchaku. Flow and style.

Exotic Ranged.Description: Mastery of tricky tools like bolas and blowguns.

Persuasion.Description: Using allure and inspiration to seduce or motivate others.

Performance.Description: Action: Acting, disguise. Lore: Art, culture, and high fashion.

Medium.Description: Mastery of chain and scale. Relying on reliability and faith.

Regalia.Description: Mastery of banners, warhorns, and badges to signal and rally troops.

Discipline.Description: Resisting fear, mind control, and maintaining order.

Command.Description: Action: Leadership, interrogation. Lore: Religion, theology, and cults.

Sunder.Description: Bonus damage against shields and armor.

Follow Through.Description: If you kill a target or break an object, deal damage to an adjacent target.

Impact.Description: Critical hits knock targets prone or fling them backwards.

Heavy Pull.Description: You can use your Might stat for damage instead of Reflex/Finesse.

Skewering Shot.Description: Your shots can pass through one enemy to hit a second one behind them.

Artillery.Description: Ignore range penalties. Your arrows punch through cover.

Loom.Description: You can Intimidate using Strength instead of Charm/Social stats.

Terrify.Description: Enemies you intimidate hesitate, acting last in the turn order.

The Aura.Description: Enemies within melee range must pass a check to attack you.

Iron Grip.Description: You cannot be disarmed or forced to drop something you are holding.

Wrecking Ball.Description: You deal double damage to inanimate objects (doors, walls).

Titan.Description: Your lifting/carrying capacity is doubled. You can swim/climb at full running speed.

Second Skin.Description: Sleeping in heavy armor causes no fatigue penalty.

Glancing Blows.Description: Reduces Critical Hit damage taken by half.

Juggernaut.Description: You cannot be knocked prone or pushed against your will while armored.

Shield Wall.Description: You provide heavy cover to adjacent allies.

Bash.Description: You can make an off-hand attack with your shield to stun enemies.

Interpose.Description: Once per round, you can take a hit meant for an adjacent ally.

Thick Skin.Description: Ignore penalties from pain or minor wounds.

Unbothered.Description: You are immune to taunts and social embarrassment.

Death\u0092s Door.Description: You stay conscious and can act for one round after hitting 0 HP.

Workhorse.Description: You can perform heavy labor for 16 hours without exhaustion.

Structural Eye.Description: You instantly spot weak points in stone/wood structures (bonus to Demolition).

Atlas.Description: For one turn, you can hold an impossible weight (e.g., a falling portcullis).

Quick Draw.Description: Drawing a hidden weapon is a free action.

Bleed Out.Description: Critical hits cause ongoing damage over time.

Vital Point.Description: You ignore armor rating on targets that are unaware of you.

Juggler.Description: You can draw and throw two small weapons in a single action.

Ricochet.Description: You can bounce thrown weapons off walls to hit enemies behind cover.

Perfect Arc.Description: Range penalties for thrown weapons are removed.

Goad.Description: Force an enemy to focus their attacks on you (drawing aggro).

Stinging Wit.Description: Your insults cause enemies to take a penalty to their next roll.

Last Word.Description: If you kill an enemy, you can demoralize their allies instantly.

Tumbler.Description: You can attempt to pick locks silently during combat.

Saboteur.Description: You can rig a trap or jam a door in half the normal time.

Skeleton Key.Description: You can unlock any non-magical lock instantly without rolling.

Fitted.Description: You suffer no stealth penalties while wearing leather/hide.

Roll With It.Description: When you take falling damage, reduce it by half.

Evasion.Description: If an AOE attack allows a save for half damage, you take zero on a success.

Fast Hands.Description: You can deploy caltrops or smoke bombs as a reaction.

Hidden Trap.Description: Enemies suffer a penalty to spot traps you have set.

Chain Reaction.Description: You can trigger your traps remotely from a distance.

Poker Face.Description: You are immune to Insight checks trying to read your emotions.

Feint.Description: You can use Guile to trick an enemy, giving you Advantage on your next attack.

Imposter.Description: You can mimic voices and mannerisms perfectly after listening for 1 minute.

Cat\u0092s Grace.Description: You possess perfect balance on narrow ledges/ropes.

Wall Run.Description: You can move vertically up walls as part of your movement.

Ghost.Description: You leave no footprints and make no sound, even when running.

Blend.Description: +2 to Stealth in natural environments matching your armor.

Regrowth.Description: While resting in Bio armor, you heal faster than normal.

Adaptation.Description: You are immune to extreme weather (heat/cold) while wearing this armor.

Field Medic.Description: Applying a salve/bandage takes half the time.

Potency.Description: Consumables you craft heal/buff for 25% more.

Witch Doctor.Description: You can scavenge nearby flora to create a generic antidote/salve anywhere.

First Impression.Description: NPCs start with a Friendly disposition towards you by default.

Radiance.Description: Your presence calms panicked crowds or allies.

Purity.Description: You are immune to non-magical diseases and look eternally youthful.

Forager.Description: You always find enough food/water for yourself in the wild.

Beast Friend.Description: Wild animals will not attack you unless provoked.

Apex.Description: You can track enemies over water or stone where no tracks should exist.

Iron Knuckle.Description: Your unarmed strikes do lethal damage instead of subdual.

Clinch.Description: You gain a bonus to grapple or hold enemies in place.

Quivering Palm.Description: You can stun an enemy with a precise unarmed strike.

Mobile Fire.Description: You do not suffer penalties for shooting while moving.

Rapid Reload.Description: Reloading a sling/shortbow is a free action.

Trick Shot.Description: You can hit buttons/levers remotely with impossible angles.

Pressure.Description: You gain bonuses to Coercion the longer the interrogation lasts.

Cornered.Description: Enemies gain a penalty to morale when they have no escape route.

The Gaze.Description: You can stop a hostile creature from attacking just by locking eyes.

Patch Job.Description: You can temporarily repair broken gear in 1 action.

Hardening.Description: Armor/Weapons you craft have higher durability than standard.

Iron Stomach.Description: You can eat spoiled food or drink mild poisons without effect.

Warded.Description: You gain a small magical shield against elemental damage.

Deep Pockets.Description: Your robes can store items in a pocket dimension (reduced weight).

Reflection.Description: Once per day, you can reflect a hostile spell back at the caster.

Channel.Description: You can hold a spell charge in your staff to release later.

Scroll Master.Description: You can use scrolls from a higher tier than your level without failure.

Overcharge.Description: You can break a wand/staff to cast a spell with maximum damage.

Protocol.Description: You never accidentally offend nobility or break local taboos.

Name Drop.Description: You can demand audience with local leaders based on your rank.

Sanctuary.Description: You can invoke laws of hospitality to prevent violence in neutral ground.

Polyglot.Description: You can read any standard language, even if you can't speak it.

Researcher.Description: You find information in libraries/archives in half the time.

Eidetic Memory.Description: You perfectly recall anything you have ever read or seen.

Parry.Description: You can use your reaction to increase your Armor Rating against one hit.

Riposte.Description: If an enemy misses you, you get a free counter-attack.

Disarm.Description: On a Critical Hit, you fling the opponent's weapon away.

Demolitionist.Description: You deal double damage to structures with explosives.

Shaped Charge.Description: Your explosives do not deal friendly-fire damage to allies.

Pyrotechnics.Description: You can craft explosives that blind or deafen instead of killing.

Filibuster.Description: You can talk in circles to stall for time, preventing combat starting.

Logic Trap.Description: If an NPC agrees to your premise, they cannot attack you without penalty.

Deconstruct.Description: You can verbally dismantle an NPC's belief system, causing a crisis of faith.

Calculator.Description: You can estimate distances, counts, and measurements instantly.

Deduction.Description: By observing a room, you can reconstruct what happened in the last hour.

Grand Design.Description: You can invent new unique blueprints for devices never seen before.

Brace.Description: You deal double damage against charging enemies.

Sweep.Description: You can trip or knock back multiple enemies in a cone.

Zone of Control.Description: Enemies provoke attacks just by entering your reach.

Steady Aim.Description: If you don't move, range penalties are halved.

Sniper.Description: If you are hidden, your shot does not reveal your exact location.

Kill Shot.Description: Bonus Critical damage on targets who are at maximum range.

Lie Detector.Description: You always know if someone is intentionally lying (doesn't detect omission).

Read Lips.Description: You can understand conversations from a distance if you can see them.

Prediction.Description: You can sense hostile intent before a weapon is even drawn (cannot be surprised).

Trap Sense.Description: You get a passive check to notice traps within 5 feet.

Tracker.Description: You can determine the number, type, and speed of creatures from tracks.

Eagle Eye.Description: Visibility penalties from fog, rain, or dim light are ignored.

Quick Change.Description: You can don or doff this armor/clothing in seconds.

Prepared.Description: You have a utility slot that produces any small mundane item you need.

Vanish.Description: While stationary in a Ghillie suit, you are effectively invisible.

Wager.Description: Once per session you can reroll a failure.

Card Sharp.Description: You can cheat at gambling games without being caught.

Fated.Description: Once per session you can force the DM/Enemy to reroll a success.

Vibe Check.Description: You instantly know the emotional state of everyone in the room.

Soothe.Description: You can remove Fear or Rage effects from an ally.

Soul Bond.Description: You share a telepathic link with one close ally.

Bad Feeling.Description: You sense if a choice will lead to Woe or Weal.

Spirit Sight.Description: You can see ghosts or invisible entities.

Omen.Description: You can declare a single fact about the future; the DM tries to make it true.

Entangle.Description: Whips/chains can grapple enemies from a distance.

Flashy.Description: Attacks give you a bonus to your next social interaction.

Pain Compliance.Description: Enemies hit by these weapons suffer a penalty to Willpower.

Debilitate.Description: Poisons applied to these weapons last twice as long.

Silver Tongue.Description: You get a discount at all merchants.

Cult of Personality.Description: You can attract a following of loyal henchmen.

Mimicry.Description: You can throw your voice to appear to come from elsewhere.

Disguise.Description: You can craft a disguise that stands up to physical inspection.

Enthrall.Description: You can captivate a crowd, distracting them so they notice nothing else.

Muffled.Description: Reduces the noise penalty of wearing metal armor.

Faith.Description: Magical healing received is more effective on you.

Unbreakable.Description: Critical Hits against you are treated as normal hits.

Colors.Description: Allies who can see your banner/symbol gain a bonus against Fear.

Rally.Description: Once per combat your signal grants all allies temporary HP.

Dread.Description: Enemies who see your banner suffer a morale penalty.

Iron Mind.Description: You have Advantage/Bonus to resist mind control.

Focus.Description: You can maintain concentration on spells/tasks even when taking damage.

Snap Out Of It.Description: You can use an action to remove a mental effect from an ally.

Orders.Description: You can grant an ally an immediate reaction attack.

Tactician.Description: Your team gains a bonus to Initiative rolls.

Martyr.Description: If an ally drops to 0 HP you can give them your HP to keep them fighting.

Herculean Effort.Description: Once per day, automatically succeed on a Strength-based check to lift or break something.

Titan's Grip.Description: You can wield Two-Handed weapons in one hand.

Marathoner.Description: You never suffer exhaustion from travel or lack of sleep (must still rest for HP).

Unkillable.Description: If you would die, you instead drop to 1 HP and become immune to damage for 1 round.

Surgical Precision.Description: You can reroll any 1s rolled on damage or skill checks involving dexterity.

Perfect Strike.Description: Your Critical Hit range expands by 2 (e.g., 18-20).

Lightning Reflexes.Description: You add your Reflex bonus to your Initiative rolls twice.

Bullet Time.Description: Take two full Actions in a single turn. (Once per long rest).

Primal Vigor.Description: Regenerate HP equal to your Vitality bonus every hour.

Timeless Body.Description: You stop aging and are immune to all non-magical diseases and poisons.

Thick Skinned.Description: Gain +1 Max HP for every level you have (retroactive).

Impervious.Description: Reduce all incoming physical damage by your Fortitude bonus.

Polymath.Description: You are considered "Proficient" in all Lore skills, even untrained ones.

Living Library.Description: Once per day, ask the GM a specific question about the world; they must answer truthfully.

Calculated Risk.Description: Analyze an enemy to gain Advantage on all attacks against them for 1 minute.

Mastermind.Description: You can retroactively declare you "prepared" for this specific situation (have the right item/key).

Sentinel.Description: You cannot be surprised while you are conscious.

True Sight.Description: See through Invisibility and Illusions out to 60ft.

Trust Your Gut.Description: The GM will warn you if you are about to walk into a lethal trap or impossible fight.

Fate Bender.Description: Force any creature (ally or enemy) to reroll a die just rolled.

Magnetism.Description: Merchants buy items for 20% more and sell for 20% less to you.

Cult Leader.Description: You can attract a dedicated follower (NPC) who serves you loyally until death.

Iron Will.Description: You have Advantage on all saves against Magic.

Unshakable.Description: You are immune to Mind Control, Possession, and Fear.

Lift.Effect: Reduce the weight of an object.

Slam.Effect: Knock target Prone with heavy force.

Heavy.Effect: You cannot be moved against your will.

Nullify.Effect: Stop all momentum in an area.

Hold.Effect: Keep a door or object shut.

Absorb.Effect: Take damage meant for an ally.

Sever.Effect: Cut off a limb or appendage.

HP.Description: Physical health. If 0, you are Dying.

CMP.Description: Mental health. If 0, you are Broken (Panic/Surrender).

SP.Description: Fuel for Physical Abilities and special attacks.

FP.Description: Fuel for Spells and Mental Abilities.

CAMO.Description: your stealth floor wont be seen if not moving

CACHE.Description: pockets or slots for quick items

THERM.Description: the range out of you comfort zone you can handle

HYDRO.Description: the range out of you comfort zone you can handle

Combat_Rules.Effect: Target is STAGGERED (No Reactions, Next Action Disadv).

Combat_Rules.Damage_Type: Force a Hit. Deal Normal Damage. (If both Overpower, both take damage).
Force a Miss. Deflect and make an immediate Free Attack.
Sunder. Take the hit but the enemy Weapon/Shield takes -1 Penalty permanently.
Retreat. No Damage. You are pushed back 5ft and lose Initiative.
1: Concussion (No Focus). 2: Broken Arm. 3: Broken Leg.
4: Eye/Ear Loss. 5: Internal Bleeding. 6: Severed Limb.

Combat_Rules.Outcome: No Reactions. Next Action has Disadvantage.
Melee hits you with Advantage. Ranged has Disadvantage.
Weapon drops in adjacent square (or flies 10ft).
0 Composure. Cannot Attack/Cast. Can only Defend/Flee.

The Whispering Savannah.Description: A vast, broken landscape dominated by tall, waving grasses that can swallow travelers whole, punctuated by rugged outcrops and dense thorny thickets.

The Canopy Forests.Description: Massive, high-altitude forests with trees large enough to support civilizations in their branches.

The Lush Valley.Description: A fertile, vibrant valley located between the spurs of the mountain chain, protected from the harsher elements.

The Petrified Crystal Forest.Description: Once a living forest, now turned into stone and crystal by Chaos energy, located within the Crystal Basin.

The Iron Caldera.Description: A harsh, endless desert centered around volcanic activity. It features grit, intense heat, and "Ironwood Oases".

The Crystal Basin.Description: An ancient ocean bed turned into a shimmering salt desert after being heaved to the surface.

The Crater-Pocked Wasteland.Description: A desolate, scarred landscape filled with impact craters.

Obsidian Flatlands.Description: Volcanic plains located on the East Coast near the jungles.

The Rusty Cliffs.Description: Rocky, inaccessible islands and cliffs along the southern coast.

The Toxic River Delta.Description: A massive, biologically hazardous river system filled with industrial runoff and natural toxins.

The Sump-Mire.Description: A dark, muddy swamp region similar to a "Bayou Noir" setting, featuring heavy fog and submerged dangers.

The Lagoons.Description: A maze of water channels along the East Coast jungles.

Southern Mineral Springs.Description: Geothermally heated springs in the southern mountains.

The Central Mountain Chain.Description: A massive range bisecting the continent, featuring snow-capped peaks and deep chasms.

The Misty Crags.Description: A vertical biome of sheer cliffs, deep shadows, and constant fog/mist.

Volcanic Islands.Description: Active volcanic chains, particularly in the North.

Chaos Zones.Description: Areas of unstable reality that separate the stable biomes. Physics do not function correctly here.

The Impact Crater.Description: A massive crater roughly in the center of the continent where the "Engineer" god rests.

The Agricultural Heartland.Description: Stable, fertile plains used for massive-scale farming.
